Subject: Agreement on Deep24 Code Ownership
To: oliverzou0@gmail.com
is_reply: false
Original: N/A
---
Michael: Hey Oliver,

Just wanted to memorialize the agreement that we had around ownership on
the Deep24 codebase.

Since you will be sharing the code with me and we are not yet sure if we
are going to be working together long term, we agreed that any edits that I
make to the repo https://github.com/amber-ai-org/open_combinator would have
an unlimited irrevocable license granted to Amber AI Inc. I would maintain
ownership of all knowhow and this would in no way bar me from working on
any related projects.

I will maintain full ownership of any edits I make to any repos other than
that one specifically.
·êß

Michael: Hi Dileepan,

Thanks for the invite ‚Äî looking forward to our conversation today.

Here‚Äôs a quick overview ahead of time:

Current Build
I‚Äôm at the early stage with geteverything.ai ‚Äî I raised a small friends-and-family pre-seed and am gearing up for another raise soon. Right now it‚Äôs just me and a few part-time collaborators, though I expect that to grow over the next six months.

The main leadership challenge I‚Äôm navigating is the tension between multiple directions: fundraising, hiring, and building. I‚Äôll often get to a point where I‚Äôm convinced THIS is the right path ‚Äî I commit fully for a few days, and then something new or shiny pulls my attention. It‚Äôs not that I don‚Äôt know what to do; it‚Äôs more that my focus keeps shifting. I‚Äôve been diagnosed with mild ADHD, and while it‚Äôs manageable, it definitely plays into the pattern. I‚Äôd like some outside perspective and accountability to create more sustained forward motion.

Why Coaching Now
I saw a few people in the YC community mention coaching and it reminded me that structured reflection and accountability can help cut through this kind of split focus. I‚Äôve done coaching before and found it helpful when it added clear frameworks and follow-through.

What I‚Äôm Looking For
Coaching would be valuable if it helps me move decisively and consistently ‚Äî reducing that internal tug-of-war and turning decisions into results. I‚Äôll know it‚Äôs working if I‚Äôm executing what I‚Äôve already decided with less friction and more output.

In terms of qualities, I value outcomes and clear thinking ‚Äî someone who uses the right tool for the job, approaches things from first principles, and can explain the reasoning behind their conclusions. I appreciate directness and care in balance, and ideally a coach who takes real ownership ‚Äî someone who tracks progress, brings observations back, and isn‚Äôt afraid to have opinions.

Background with Coaching
I‚Äôve worked with several coaches, advisors, and therapists. The main gaps I‚Äôve found were too little homework, too little structure around the journey itself, and not enough accountability between sessions. I‚Äôd like a coach who helps build and track a concrete map of progress, not just hold a single conversation each week.

Practical Details
‚Ä¢ Budget: Low thousands per month
‚Ä¢ Decision Maker: Just me
‚Ä¢ Timeline: Ready to start immediately or within the next week

Looking forward to connecting and diving into it.

Best,
Michael
